intro: Brassica oleracea var. crispa, commonly known as curly kale, is a leafy vegetable characterized by its crinkled, dark green leaves. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is a cultivar of the species Brassica oleracea. The plant typically grows to a height of about 50–100 cm, with thick, fibrous stalks and broad, wavy leaves. It is rich in nutrients such as vitamins A, C, and K, as well as minerals like calcium and iron. The leaves are usually harvested before the plant bolts, ensuring optimal flavor and texture.
